title: I am 22 now, is it too late to start learning contemporary dance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not at all, I personally didn’t start learning at a very young age, I advise you to start with Ballet Classes so you learn the basics, or you can check if the contemporary class does include some ballet exercises in the beginning, right before the stretching session. Try and attend a minimum of 2 classes a week and don’t stop unless you have to…it will include lots of stretching exercises in each session before going through the steps of each dance. Within a year, you will start noticing the flexibility of your body and your ability to create your own choreography.

Practicing and learning. Taking class, showing up, exploring. Questioning how your movement works, what your habits are and challenging them. If you read the biographies of many really well known dancers and choreographers you’ll see that many of them started dancing well into their 20s or beyond. I started dancing at 19 and am totally committed to it. At college, my tutors commented that it took me longer to learn sequences (because I was not familiar with the vocabulary) but when I learnt them I had often read the movement more accurately than most of my peers (because I had no preconceptions about how to do the movement). Dance is a long road - they say it takes at least 7 years to make a dancer, so start now and keep going.
